ft
Class Interface

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--ft.Interface
public class Interface
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants, java.lang.Runnable

manages connection to the interface.

Inner Class Summary
protected  class Interface.Analog
          holds state of one analog input.
static interface Interface.AnalogObserver
          must be implemented to observe values of analog inputs.
protected  class Interface.Cycle
          holds cycle counter.
static interface Interface.CycleObserver
          must be implemented to observe state refresh cycles.
protected  class Interface.Digital
          holds state of all digital inputs.
static interface Interface.DigitalObserver
          must be implemented to observe edges and digital inputs.
protected static class Interface.Model
          base class for models, manages state and calls observers.
protected  class Interface.Motor
          holds state of one output.
static interface Interface.MotorObserver
          must be implemented to observe changes of motor states.
protected static class Interface.Queue
          used to detach notifying any model's observers from changing the model's state.

finalize in class java.lang.Object

run

public void run()
monitor the interface; run once only. Loops to output motor state and input digital and analog values. Informs the various models.
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

add ft.properties to system properties.

public void addObserver(int mask,
                        Interface.MotorObserver o)
Parameters:
mask - M1.. or-ed together for motors to be observed.
o - to receive edge() notifications.

setScale

public void setScale(int mask,
                     float a,
                     float b)
set scale of analog inputs: raw input is scaled as a*raw + b. Observers are only informed, if scaled value changed.
Parameters:
mask - EX.. or-ed together for analog inputs to be manipulated.

change the query pattern. This does not start/stop analog observing.

static void ()
add ft.properties to system properties.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
hack to measure performance. Use ft.properties to set digital vs. complete queries. ft.Interface commPortId [count] will output the number of milliseconds for count inquiries.
